msContents.summary: This Nepalese paper manuscript, written in Kathmandu by a certain Tailapati in 1834 in the mahāvihāra called Ratnaketu, contains the Yogāmbarasamādhipūjāpaddhati, a tantric ritual manual dedicated to Yogāmbara, an important deity of the Kathmandu Valley. He is a so-called 'lineage-deity' (degu/deguli), the focus of special devotion by several Newar monasteries, including the famous Golden Temple in Patan. Unlike other significant tantric deities, Yogāmbara does not have a central scripture of his own. His cult probably has its ancient origins in Eastern India.

msItem.title: Yogāmbarasamādhipūjāpaddhati
Yogāmbaradeguli
msItem.rubric: [1l1] $ oṃ nama śrīvajrasatvāya namaḥ || śrīgurubhya namaḥ śrīmat_sāṣyamūnitathātāya namaḥ ||
msItem.incipit: [1l2] $ oṃ namaḥ śrīyogāmbarāyaḥ sarvvabhāvātmakaṃ, natvā yogi¦[1l3]nijālanāyakaṃ, yogāmbaraṃ jagannāthaṃ, kuru c ā i rataḥ sa[1l4]dā || samanvāharantu māṃ buddhāḥ aśeṣāṃ dikṣāsasphitāḥ || 3
msItem.explicit: [39l1, c1] $ satvaśaṃtānā hūṃ 19 [39l2, c1] $ āliṅganābhīnayena [39l3, c1] satvasaṃntānasaṃjñakaṃ [39l1, c2] abhūtadharmmadeśanā hūṃ 20 [39l2, c2] praṇāmāñjali saṃdhāryya [39l3, c2] abhūtādharmmadeśanaṃ [39l1, c3] viṃsatirāsyākārayat_ ||
msItem.colophon: [40l1] śudhaṃ vā aśudhaṃ vā ḥ sūdhanitaṃ mahaṃ buddhaḥ prati[40l2]tapratigunakṛtaṃ ḥ mama doṣa na diyata ^^^ riṣitaṃ suvarṇṇapalāṇi mahānagare ratnake[40l3]tumahāvihāre vāsitaḥ hvālavāhālayāḥ hnulavāhāla saconāvelasaḥ thva madhyamaśrī 3 [40l4]jogāmbaradeguliḥ thajetadhakaṃcoyāḥ śrīvarjācār-1- tailapatina riṣitaṃ śubhasaṃvat_ || nepālasaṃvat_ 954 sti phārgunaśudi 5 saḥ vṛspativāra śubhaṃ || @ || @ || ^^ || ^^ ||

layout.p: 7 lines per page, approximately 33 akṣaras per line.
Triple marginal frame lines in black and red ink. Blank spaces left for illustrations framed by double lines. Ruling. The last six pages have been left unwritten.

decoNote.desc: The manuscript was meant to be illustarted with numerous depictions of hand-gestures (mudrās), also employing drums, bells, flowers, weapons, vajras. However, only four hand-gestures have been drawn, on page 3, while spaces have been left blank (often with invocations and the name of the hand-gesture written at the top and at the bottom, resepctively) on pages 1, 4, 5, 7, 8, 12, 13, 15, 16, 34, 35, 36, 37, 38, 39.

physDesc.additions:
On the Front page, notes in Nepālākṣara:
guruyā upadesalāya
vidhātā riṣitā jasya lalātakṣala
$ gurubuddhagurudharmmagurusaṃghaṃtathyaṃvaca
oṃ namo ratnatrayāyaḥ
satguruka
On the End page, notes in Nepālākṣara:
śrī sākyamuṇibhagavā
nama devi
$ nama śrīgurubhya nama || śrīvajasatvāya namo stu nama
iti yajogāṃvara
sāladāya nama
$ nama śrī aṣṭamātṛkāya nama
māyādevi
sākemuni bhagavān
māyā namo haṃ
prajaṃsya silasābuddhaṃ taikṣādhipratiprabhunānāsāstraṃ ditavakṣarājanitīsamuścayaṃ

history.provenance: Bought by Wright, Daniel Dr. D. Wright in 1873-6.
